dublin_core.dcvalue: It has been suggested that joint teleconsultations can improve communication at the primary secondary care interface We examined data from a qualitative analysis of social interactions in teleconsultations between specialists and general practitioners The primary interaction was between specialists and patients The general practitioners mostly adopted a back seat role listening and observing but not becoming actively involved Teleconsultations create a number of interactional difficulties which are likely to impede implementation and sustainability
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:29:29Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2006-08-03
A qualitative study of communication during joint teleconsultations at the primary-secondary care interface.
